item.title: Caddy Server Acquired By Apilayer
item.description: Ardan Labs partnership with Caddy Server has led to the acquisition of the popular free open-source web server platform by Apilayer. http://www.prweb.com/releases/caddy_server_acquired_by_apilayer/prweb17367009.htm Ardan Labs announces they have secured the acquisition of Caddy Server with Apilayer. Caddy is a leading open-source extensible web server platform (written in the Go programming language) that has secured trillions of network connections around the globe. Apilayer a leading provider of cloud-based API and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) brands.
item.author: (Ardan LabsAugust 27, 2020)

item.title: Let employees sell their equity
item.description: Sometimes people choose to work for one company over another for reasons related to the work environment, for example what the company does, and whether the other employees create a place that's pleasant to work at. But a major factor is compensation. If Company A and Company B are largely comparable, but Company A offers $30,000 more in base pay per year more than Company B, most people will choose Company A.

item.title: Learn C# with CSharpFritz - Ep 4: C# Conditionals and Loops for Beginners
item.description:
This is episode 4 of C# with CSharpFritz and Jeff teaches the basics of If, and Switch statements as well as For, While and Do loops in this beginner-friendly 'talk radio style' episode.
Interactive Notebook with samples you can run IN BROWSER at: https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/csharpfritz/csharp_with_csharpfritz/main
After the C# basics sessions are completed, which user interface framework do you want Fritz to walk through FIRST? Vote for your favorite with an emote at: https://github.com/csharpfritz/csharp_with_csharpfritz/issues/13
Questions: 16:28 - After learning all this basics. How do we learn to implement real-life applications? 26:15 - Can you recommend some extensions for C# style editing in Visual Studio? 28:29 - When in a method is better to use if-else or if-return sentences? 35:19 - Do if-else and switch statements have the same performance? Is it safe to use switch-case? 50:45 - What would be the best beginner language if I want to code for a Raspberry Pi? 1:26:15 - How do you write multi-line code branches in switch expressions? 1:32:53 - Please show infinite for loops 1:37:16 - What happens in you decrement the counter in the for loop as one of the statements? 1:38:45 - What about counter++ vs ++counter?
Background Music is Harris Heller's Streambeats - Synthwave playlist, available royalty free at https://open.spotify.com/playlist/2gj... Source code and interactive content from the stream are available at: https://github.com/csharpfritz/csharp_with_csharpfritz Watch live Mondays at 1300 UTC / 9a ET / 6a PT at: https://twitch.tv/visualstudio
item.author: (dotNET)

item.title: Stop Watching YouTube
item.description:
A few months ago, I logged out.
But I actually took it one step further: I removed the ability for YouTube to save cookies on my browser.
With no cookies, YouTube couldn’t identify who I was.
Since YouTube had no idea who I was, they couldn't use their super-smart algorithm to trick me into watc
item.author: (Pat Walls)

item.title: Workshop Module 6: Distributed Data
item.description: We consider best practices for managing distributed data following the widely-accepted Database per Microservice pattern. Emphasis is on managing consistency when implementing cross-service queries and transactions. Coverage of Materialized View Patterns, Sagas, CQRS, and Event Sourcing. Discussion of relational and No-SQL Options in Azure.
item.author: (dotNET)

item.title: Access Linux filesystems in Windows and WSL 2 | Windows Command Line
item.description: Starting with Windows Insiders preview build 20211, WSL 2 will be offering a new feature: wsl --mount. This new parameter allows a physical disk to be attached and mounted inside WSL 2, which enables you to access filesystems that aren’t natively supported by Windows (such as ext4).
item.author: (Pierre Boulay Software Engineer II, Linux on Windows)

item.title: Why it is Important that Software Projects Fail
item.description: Some put this down to organizational culture. If an engineer were to deliberately under specify a load bearing beam in order to cut costs, they would be sent to jail. But when a programmer cuts a corner they get promoted. Others suggest that the problem domains are fundamentally different. But all commentators assume that failure is detrimental to society. This paper sets out to correct that misunderstanding.
